response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for datetime Code with Pytest (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of testing strategies for working with datetime objects in Python 3.12+ using the popular testing framework, pytest.
key_points: Important considerations when testing datetime code
Utilizing built-in and third-party libraries for better testing
Writing effective test cases for common datetime operations
Best practices for handling timezones and localization

code_examples.code:
from datetime import datetime
from dateutil.tz import tzutc

def test_datetime_with_timezone():
    utc_date = datetime(2023, 5, 19, 14, 30, 0, tzinfo=tzutc())
    assert utc_date.astimezone().strftime('%Z') == 'UTC'

version_notes: Pytest 7.1.2 is used in examples, which supports Python 3.12+
Some additional dependencies such as dateutil may be required for certain tests
caveats: Ensure test data includes edge cases and unusual inputs to cover a wide range of possible datetime values
Be mindful of the differences between datetime objects and strings when comparing or asserting their equality
